text: Vernon Eulion Jordan Jr. (August 15, 1935 â€“ March 1, 2021) was an American businessman and civil rights activist. He worked for many Civil Rights Movement organizations. He was a presidential adviser to President Bill Clinton. Jordan died at his home in Washington, D.C. on March 1, 2021 at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American civil rights activists Category:Lawyers from Atlanta Category:Businesspeople from Atlanta Category:Businesspeople from Washington, D.C.
